title: Waste-to-Value and Low-Carbon Infrastructure Leader Nexus PMG Raises $50 Million to Accelerate Its Services and ... - PR Newswire
summary: Nexus PMG is a leader in low-carbon infrastructure, providing advisory services and developing sustainable assets to support the production of green fuels from waste. The company focuses on converting organic waste into renewable energy and has a growing portfolio of projects aimed at reducing emissions in tough-to-abate sectors. With significant investments and partnerships, Nexus PMG aims to expand its offerings and expertise to meet the increasing demand for low-carbon infrastructure. Their operations include two subsidiaries dedicated to waste-to-value projects, contributing to overall energy transition goals.
green_innovation: TRUE - This article describes Nexus PMG's efforts to develop greenfield and brownfield assets to create low-carbon products, contributing to environmental sustainability by reducing harmful emissions.
business_innovation: TRUE - Nexus PMG's integrated advisory services and the development of low-carbon infrastructure represent significant improvements to their previous business processes, making it a business innovation.
green_product: FALSE - While Nexus PMG develops low-carbon products, the article does not specifically identify any individual green products that fit the comprehensive definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE - The processes described by Nexus PMG, such as converting waste into renewable natural gas and sustainable aviation fuel, minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: {'Likely NAICS Codes': [{'code': '541618', 'category': 'Other Management Consulting Services'}, {'code': '562213', 'category': 'Solid Waste Disposal'}, {'code': '324110', 'category': 'Petroleum Refineries'}, {'code': '325199', 'category': 'All Other Basic Organic Chemical Manufacturing'}]}
greenwashing: FALSE - The article does not suggest any misleading statements or exaggerations about the environmental benefits of Nexus PMG's practices, therefore it does not exemplify greenwashing.

title: Antioxidant-packed GM purple tomatoes get FDA green light - AgFunderNews
summary: Norfolk Plant Sciences has completed a pre-market consultation with the FDA for genetically engineered purple tomatoes, which are designed to have high levels of health-promoting anthocyanins. This consultation aims to build public trust and support growers in marketing the reviewed product. The tomatoes feature both purple skin and flesh, enhancing their antioxidant content and freshness compared to conventional varieties. A soft launch for fresh purple tomatoes has begun, with plans for expanded production and distribution in the future.
green_innovation: TRUE. This represents green innovation as the development of genetically engineered purple tomatoes is designed to enhance nutritional value while potentially reducing waste due to their longer freshness.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of a new product, the purple tomatoes, represents a significant improvement over conventional tomatoes due to their enhanced nutritional benefits and the innovative genetic modification involved.
green_product: TRUE. The purple tomatoes qualify as a green product because they are designed to reduce environmental impacts and enhance health benefits through increased antioxidant levels throughout their lifecycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not provide evidence of a new or improved manufacturing or production process specifically designed to minimize environmental impacts.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 111998 - All Other Miscellaneous Crop Farming, 325413 - Insecticide and Pesticide Manufacturing, 541715 - Research and Development in the Physical, Engineering, and Life Sciences (except Nanotechnology and Biotechnology), 446191 - Food (Health) Supplement Stores
greenwashing: FALSE. The article does not suggest greenwashing as it provides legitimate information about the product's consultations with regulatory authorities and the potential health benefits of the purple tomatoes, indicating transparency rather than deceptive marketing.
